page.title: List of characters in Chrono Trigger

rev.diff:
Line 50: Line 50:
=== Ayla ===
=== Ayla ===
â
[[Image:Ayla.jpg|thumb|100px|right|Ayla]]
 
{{nihongo|'''Ayla'''|ã¨ã¤ã©|Eira}}, is the chief of the Ioka tribe in 65,000,000 B.C. Her people are in constant war against the Reptites, an evolved, intelligent race of reptiles. She is characterized as fiercely courageous, decisively confident, and morally pure. After [[Lavos]] hits the planet, dust blasts into the atmosphere and blocks out the sun. This causes an ice age and the extinction of the Reptites; Ayla subsequently retires from her duties as chief. Ayla cannot use magic because she was born before humans became genetically capable of doing so (as further explained through human evolution in ''Chrono Cross''). She relies on unarmed combat and physical prowess in battle. Interestingly, in the original Japanese version, she makes a [[bisexual]] comment upon meeting the party (which was censored to "respect" in the English release).
{{nihongo|'''Ayla'''|ã¨ã¤ã©|Eira}}, is the chief of the Ioka tribe in 65,000,000 B.C. Her people are in constant war against the Reptites, an evolved, intelligent race of reptiles. She is characterized as fiercely courageous, decisively confident, and morally pure. After [[Lavos]] hits the planet, dust blasts into the atmosphere and blocks out the sun. This causes an ice age and the extinction of the Reptites; Ayla subsequently retires from her duties as chief. Ayla cannot use magic because she was born before humans became genetically capable of doing so (as further explained through human evolution in ''Chrono Cross''). She relies on unarmed combat and physical prowess in battle. Interestingly, in the original Japanese version, she makes a [[bisexual]] comment upon meeting the party (which was censored to "respect" in the English release).
Line 56: Line 55:
=== Magus ===
=== Magus ===
â
[[Image:Magus new art.jpg|thumb|140px|right|Magus]]
 
'''Magus''', known in Japan as {{nihongo|'''Maou'''|é­ç|MaÅ|lit. Demon King}}, is the dark wizard waging war against the Kingdom of Guardia in 600 A.D. Magus was originally '''Janus''' ({{nihongo|ã¸ã£ã­|Jaki}} in the Japanese version), the young prince of Zeal in 12000 B.C. After an encounter with Lavos as a boy, he was sent through a time gate to the Middle Ages. Vindictive and vengeful against Lavos, and eternally concerned over the fate of his sister Schala, he is portrayed as brooding, potent, and gloomy. He fights using a [[scythe]], as well as a combination of all magic types. He is an optional character but is nonetheless an iconic cast member of ''Chrono Trigger'' with many fans, and he has appeared in three [[GameFAQs]] character battles.<ref name="character-battle1">{{cite web | year=2003 | title=Character Battle II | url=http://www.gamefaqs.com/features/contest/c03sum | publisher=GameFAQs | accessdate=2006-10-02}}</ref><ref name="character-battle2">{{cite web | year=2004 | title=Character Battle III | url=http://www.gamefaqs.com/features/contest/c04sum | publisher=GameFAQs | accessdate=2006-10-02}}</ref><ref name="character-battle3">{{cite web | year=2005 | title=Character Battle IV | url=http://www.gamefaqs.com/features/contest/sum05 | publisher=GameFAQs | accessdate=2006-10-02}}</ref>
'''Magus''', known in Japan as {{nihongo|'''Maou'''|é­ç|MaÅ|lit. Demon King}}, is the dark wizard waging war against the Kingdom of Guardia in 600 A.D. Magus was originally '''Janus''' ({{nihongo|ã¸ã£ã­|Jaki}} in the Japanese version), the young prince of Zeal in 12000 B.C. After an encounter with Lavos as a boy, he was sent through a time gate to the Middle Ages. Vindictive and vengeful against Lavos, and eternally concerned over the fate of his sister Schala, he is portrayed as brooding, potent, and gloomy. He fights using a [[scythe]], as well as a combination of all magic types. He is an optional character but is nonetheless an iconic cast member of ''Chrono Trigger'' with many fans, and he has appeared in three [[GameFAQs]] character battles.<ref name="character-battle1">{{cite web | year=2003 | title=Character Battle II | url=http://www.gamefaqs.com/features/contest/c03sum | publisher=GameFAQs | accessdate=2006-10-02}}</ref><ref name="character-battle2">{{cite web | year=2004 | title=Character Battle III | url=http://www.gamefaqs.com/features/contest/c04sum | publisher=GameFAQs | accessdate=2006-10-02}}</ref><ref name="character-battle3">{{cite web | year=2005 | title=Character Battle IV | url=http://www.gamefaqs.com/features/contest/sum05 | publisher=GameFAQs | accessdate=2006-10-02}}</ref>
